skill.name: ui-component-creation
skill.description: Creates UI components using shadcn/ui and design system patterns
skill.summary: Creates UI components using shadcn/ui and design system patterns
skill.author: CleanExpo

security_audit.summary: This is a pure markdown documentation skill containing only guidelines for creating UI components. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system operations exist beyond reading documentation. The static analyzer findings are completely erroneous - the skill is safe and contains no security risks.

content.user_title: Create UI Components with shadcn/ui Patterns
content.value_statement: Generate consistent, accessible UI components that follow design system guidelines. Ensures visual distinctiveness, brand alignment, and accessibility compliance for every component.
actual_capabilities: Generate React 19 components with shadcn/ui patterns
Apply design tokens for consistent theming
Implement accessibility attributes and ARIA labels
Add responsive breakpoints and all interaction states
Follow brand guidelines for visual distinctiveness
limitations: Requires existing shadcn/ui component library installation
Requires access to DESIGN-SYSTEM.md for token definitions
Does not create new design tokens or modify design system

use_cases.title: Build Consistent Components
use_cases.description: Create new React components that match existing design patterns and brand guidelines

use_cases.title: Translate Designs to Code
use_cases.description: Convert design specifications into accessible, production-ready component code

use_cases.title: Rapid Prototyping
use_cases.description: Quickly scaffold UI components with proper structure and accessibility built-in

prompt_templates.title: Basic Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a card component using shadcn/ui patterns. Use the design system tokens for colors and spacing. Include title and description props.

prompt_templates.title: Form Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a form component with text input and submit button. Apply focus states, error handling, and accessibility labels. Use design tokens.

prompt_templates.title: Interactive Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a modal component with open, close, and loading states. Include keyboard navigation and ARIA attributes. Match brand colors.

prompt_templates.title: Complex Dashboard Widget
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a dashboard widget showing metrics with chart placeholder, trend indicator, and action buttons. Handle all responsive breakpoints and accessibility requirements.

output_examples.input: Create a user profile card component with avatar, name, role, and contact button
output: UserProfileCard component with avatar, name, role, bio props
Button with accent-500 brand color for primary action
Accessible with proper ARIA labels and focus states
Responsive with md: and lg: breakpoints

output_examples.input: Create a settings form with toggle switches and save button
output: SettingsForm with toggle components for each preference
Each toggle has label, checked state, and aria-label
Save button with loading state and error handling
Uses design tokens for all styling

best_practices: Always read DESIGN-SYSTEM.md before generating any UI component
Use design tokens (bg-bg-card, text-text-primary) instead of raw colors
Include all interaction states: hover, focus, active, disabled
anti_patterns: Using raw colors like bg-white instead of design tokens
Skipping accessibility attributes for keyboard users
Ignoring responsive breakpoints on complex layouts

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works with any AI assistant that can read markdown guidelines.

faq.question: Does this create a full page or individual components?
faq.answer: Creates individual UI components. For full pages, compose multiple components following the same patterns.

faq.question: Can I use this with custom design systems?
faq.answer: Yes. Replace design token references with your own CSS variables or utility classes.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only generates code patterns. No user data is collected, stored, or transmitted.

faq.question: Why must I read DESIGN-SYSTEM.md first?
faq.answer: The design system file contains brand-specific color tokens and spacing values for consistency.

faq.question: How is this different from plain shadcn/ui?
faq.answer: Adds brand guidelines, accessibility requirements, responsive patterns, and quality gates.
